result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 10 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $3,245.23 is ordered payable as follows:  $500 to MCR Services ($500 cash bail applied) and $2,745.23 to Federated Insurance Company.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with MCR Services.
Defendant to contact Probation and Parole by 09:00 a.m. on 11-07-2016.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort.

Court Grants - DOC request by one year - However, if restitution is paid off probation can be terminated early.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adam M Webb in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   
Court to address - Active Warrant - For Non-Compliance with WCS.

State moves to amend the charge from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

Court quashes the warrant.
Bail is reinstated.


Court orders the following:
200 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
10 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.
 
Term of Probation: 1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ;

No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  MCR Services.
Defendant to contact Probation by 9 am Monday Morning (11/07/16).
